coils-of-the-medusa.name: Coils of the Medusa
coils-of-the-medusa.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1.
Sacrifice Coils of the Medusa: Destroy all non-Wall creatures blocking enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Serpentine locks shape ornate rocks.

"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

kami-of-tattered-shoji.name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
kami-of-tattered-shoji.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.

grapeshot-catapult.name: Grapeshot Catapult
grapeshot-catapult.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

editions.flavor: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.
For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.
The Southern Paladin taught the airborne vermin to fear the storm that rains upward.
Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.
For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

brutal-suppression.name: Brutal Suppression
brutal-suppression.text: Activated abilities of nontoken Rebels cost an additional "Sacrifice a land" to activate.

editions.flavor:
"They no longer care about their own suffering. Show them something worse."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

brass-herald.name: Brass Herald
brass-herald.text:
As Brass Herald enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
When Brass Herald enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all creature cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.

path-of-peace.name: Path of Peace
path-of-peace.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier
The soldier reaped the profits of peace.

"When the sword becomes a burden, let the warrior lay it aside that another with a truer heart might take it up."
—Radiant, archangel

"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

hundred-talon-strike.name: Hundred-Talon Strike
hundred-talon-strike.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

floodbringer.name: Floodbringer
floodbringer.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Tap target land.

editions.flavor: "Such a small thing, a drop of water . . . And yet enough of them together can flood a field, cleanse a mire, or choke a forest."

psychic-spear.name: Psychic Spear
psychic-spear.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a Spirit or Arcane card from it. That player discards that card.

editions.flavor:
"The wizards of Takenuma Swamp faced the horrors of humanity every day. It's no wonder they fared so well against the kami."
—Observations of the Kami War

kami-of-false-hope.name: Kami of False Hope
kami-of-false-hope.text: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

bog-rats.name: Bog Rats
bog-rats.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

editions.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

ogre-marauder.name: Ogre Marauder
ogre-marauder.text: Whenever Ogre Marauder attacks, it gains "Ogre Marauder can't be blocked" until end of turn unless defending player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: Once freed, the oni demanded more and more sacrifices to appease them. The ogres happily obliged.

prowling-nightstalker.name: Prowling Nightstalker
prowling-nightstalker.text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.

editions.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.
Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

moonlit-strider.name: Moonlit Strider
moonlit-strider.text:
Sacrifice Moonlit Strider: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

kikus-shadow.name: Kiku's Shadow
kikus-shadow.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

editions.flavor:
"Me? No, I'm not going to kill you. I won't even lay a finger on you. I promise."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

callow-jushi.name: Callow Jushi
callow-jushi.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Callow Jushi.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Callow Jushi, you may flip it.

mind-warp.name: Mind Warp
mind-warp.text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.

editions.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

fiddlehead-kami.name: Fiddlehead Kami
fiddlehead-kami.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate Fiddlehead Kami.

editions.flavor:
"Like a riddle, it unwinds.
Like a green wind, it reaches out.
Like a sudden guilt, it seizes."
—Snow Fur, kitsune poet

endbringer.name: Endbringer
endbringer.text:
Untap Endbringer during each other player's untap step.
{T}: Endbringer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{C}, {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
{C}{C}, {T}: Draw a card.

kondas-hatamoto.name: Konda's Hatamoto
kondas-hatamoto.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
As long as you control a legendary Samurai, Konda's Hatamoto gets +1/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

kitsune-loreweaver.name: Kitsune Loreweaver
kitsune-loreweaver.text: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."

genju-of-the-fens.name: Genju of the Fens
genju-of-the-fens.text:
Enchant Swamp
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.
When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana

time-ebb.name: Time Ebb
time-ebb.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

"Yesterday you were just a figment of your master's imagination. I liked you better then."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard

"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

jetting-glasskite.name: Jetting Glasskite
jetting-glasskite.text:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.

editions.flavor: The bolt struck with a flash, and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.
The bolt struck with a flash and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

glimmering-angel.name: Glimmering Angel
glimmering-angel.text:
Flying
{U}: Glimmering Angel gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"We turned to see where the blow came from and saw only a distant light."
—Capashen lord

disrupting-shoal.name: Disrupting Shoal
disrupting-shoal.text:
You may exile a blue card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Disrupting Shoal's mana cost.
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is X.

dry-spell.name: Dry Spell
dry-spell.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

"My soul thirsts for Serra's salvation, as does my body for life's breath."
—Ihsan's Shade
A fist of dust to line your throat, a bowl of sand to fill your belly.

"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

quillmane-baku.name: Quillmane Baku
quillmane-baku.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Quillmane Baku.
{1}, {T}, Remove X ki counters from Quillmane Baku: Return target creature with converted mana cost X or less to its owner's hand.

stir-the-grave.name: Stir the Grave
stir-the-grave.text: Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"Your lungs may not draw breath, but while your hands can grip a sword, you will be useful to me."
—Nighteyes, nezumi necromancer

kemuri-onna.name: Kemuri-Onna
kemuri-onna.text:
When Kemuri-Onna enters the battlefield, target player discards a card.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kemuri-Onna to its owner's hand.

araba-mothrider.name: Araba Mothrider
araba-mothrider.text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"My finest creations are fashioned after the moths of Eiganjo. They fly higher, faster, and more gracefully than any of my own designs."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

ethereal-haze.name: Ethereal Haze
ethereal-haze.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Imagine a dove flying through smoke. Does the dove injure the smoke? Does the smoke impede the dove?"
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

minamo-sightbender.name: Minamo Sightbender
minamo-sightbender.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.
Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.

soratami-mirror-mage.name: Soratami Mirror-Mage
soratami-mirror-mage.text:
Flying
{3}, Return three lands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "The clouds obey my whims, and you'll obey theirs."

heart-of-light.name: Heart of Light
heart-of-light.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"There is a shining in the mortal heart that even the kami cannot reach."
—Sensei Golden-Tail
For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

call-for-blood.name: Call for Blood
call-for-blood.text:
As an additional cost to cast Call for Blood, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.

ronin-warclub.name: Ronin Warclub
ronin-warclub.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+1.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, attach Ronin Warclub to that creature.
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

flowstone-charger.name: Flowstone Charger
flowstone-charger.text: Whenever Flowstone Charger attacks, it gets +3/-3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A mane of flowstone and a mien of fury.

takenos-cavalry.name: Takeno's Cavalry
takenos-cavalry.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.

editions.flavor: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.

phantom-wings.name: Phantom Wings
phantom-wings.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Sacrifice Phantom Wings: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "But you said ‘when goats fly!'" Squee whined.
Many kami could fly, which put some warriors at a distinct disadvantage. The mages of Minamo took it upon themselves to correct that imbalance.

heed-the-mists.name: Heed the Mists
heed-the-mists.text: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard, then draw cards equal to that card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Once, I looked to the mists for wisdom. Now I wish only for understanding."

oppressive-will.name: Oppressive Will
oppressive-will.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

raiding-nightstalker.name: Raiding Nightstalker
raiding-nightstalker.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

kiyomaro-first-to-stand.name: Kiyomaro, First to Stand
kiyomaro-first-to-stand.text:
Kiyomaro, First to Stand's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
As long as you have four or more cards in hand, Kiyomaro has vigilance.
Whenever Kiyomaro deals damage, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 7 life.

zombie-master.name: Zombie Master
zombie-master.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."

editions.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

split-tail-miko.name: Split-Tail Miko
split-tail-miko.text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."

clockwork-swarm.name: Clockwork Swarm
clockwork-swarm.text:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

chisei-heart-of-oceans.name: Chisei, Heart of Oceans
chisei-heart-of-oceans.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Chisei, Heart of Oceans unless you remove a counter from a permanent you control.

"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

"Day 31: I finally succeeded in my time reversal experiment!
"Day 30: I might have a problem here."
—Journal of the Prime Izmagnus

—Sidar Jabari

temple-acolyte.name: Temple Acolyte
temple-acolyte.text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.

crawling-filth.name: Crawling Filth
crawling-filth.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

scourge-of-numai.name: Scourge of Numai
scourge-of-numai.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life if you don't control an Ogre.

editions.flavor:
"Where a once-proud human city stood, only the ruins of Numai remain, deep amid rotting bamboo and plagued by oni."
—The History of Kamigawa

mending-hands.name: Mending Hands
mending-hands.text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer
The dead sing their own lullabies.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor:
"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise

"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

"Death is not a debt I am yet willing to pay."
—Purraj of Urborg

"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

ward-of-piety.name: Ward of Piety
ward-of-piety.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

editions.flavor: Reluctant to strike at the kami directly, some kitsune trained in more passive fighting techniques.

gibbering-kami.name: Gibbering Kami
gibbering-kami.text:
Flying
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

wings-of-hope.name: Wings of Hope
wings-of-hope.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Urza knew Phyrexians would come through the air and sent his soldiers to greet them.

mystic-restraints.name: Mystic Restraints
mystic-restraints.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Mystic Restraints enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

zombie-boa.name: Zombie Boa
zombie-boa.text: {1}{B}: Choose a color. Whenever Zombie Boa becomes blocked by a creature of that color this turn, destroy that creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: It doesn't need to feed, but still it hungers.

"Rise like the sun, stand like the mountain, charge like the lion, die as a hero."
—General Takeno

"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

shadow-rider.name: Shadow Rider
shadow-rider.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: In its world of complete darkness, it has no shadows to fear.

soratami-mindsweeper.name: Soratami Mindsweeper
soratami-mindsweeper.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

rag-dealer.name: Rag Dealer
rag-dealer.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"After General Takeno found the Oathkeeper amidst the bamboo marshes, more scavengers braved the swamp's nezumi, oni, and kami in hopes of glory."
—The History of Kamigawa

skullmane-baku.name: Skullmane Baku
skullmane-baku.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Skullmane Baku.
{1}, {T}, Remove X ki counters from Skullmane Baku: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

indebted-samurai.name: Indebted Samurai
indebted-samurai.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.

editions.flavor: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."

hired-muscle.name: Hired Muscle
hired-muscle.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Hired Muscle.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Hired Muscle, you may flip it.

umezawas-jitte.name: Umezawa's Jitte
umezawas-jitte.text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put two charge counters on Umezawa's Jitte.

ribbons-of-the-reikai.name: Ribbons of the Reikai
ribbons-of-the-reikai.text: Draw a card for each Spirit you control.

editions.flavor:
"If wisdom is a river, then we cup our hands, reach in, and drink from it in sips. The kami, however, are like fish, swimming, breathing, surrounded in its presence."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

ancestors-chosen.name: Ancestor's Chosen
ancestors-chosen.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Empowered by generations of strength.
"The will of all, by my hand done."

predatory-nightstalker.name: Predatory Nightstalker
predatory-nightstalker.text: When Predatory Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent sacrifice a creature.

mannichi-the-fevered-dream.name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
mannichi-the-fevered-dream.text: {1}{R}: Switch each creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—The History of Kamigawa

empty-shrine-kannushi.name: Empty-Shrine Kannushi
empty-shrine-kannushi.text: Empty-Shrine Kannushi has protection from the colors of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: "Crease the folds, bend the paper, turn the spirits, shield the soul."

shield-of-duty-and-reason.name: Shield of Duty and Reason
shield-of-duty-and-reason.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green and from blue.

editions.flavor: The duty: to defend. The reason: to survive.

kabuto-moth.name: Kabuto Moth
kabuto-moth.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Many great warriors died in the first days of the war, as the spirits of their weaponry turned against them with terrifying rage."
—Observations of the Kami War
